net.sourceforge.cilib.Container.Graph
Class Graph

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.cilib.Container.Graph.Graph
Direct Known Subclasses:
DirectedGraph
public class Graph
extends java.lang.Object

An implementation of a Acyclic Graph Data structure.

Author:
Gary Pampara

indexOf

public int indexOf(Vertex v)
Get the index of the vertex as contained in the internal container. This value will always be between 0 and getNumberOfVerticies(). This is an accessor method to give the same functionality as operator[]

Parameters:
v - The Vertex to have it's iondex returned
Returns:
The index of the Vertex in the internal container

getEdges

public java.util.ListIterator getEdges()
Get an Iterator to the edge set

Returns:
An Iterator to the edge set

getEdgeBetweenVerticies

public Edge getEdgeBetweenVerticies(Vertex v1,
                                    Vertex v2)
Get the associated edge between two verticies.

Parameters:
v1 - A vertex to reference the edge from
v2 - A vertex to reference the edge to
Returns:
The Edge created by the two verticies v1 and v2

getVertices

public java.util.ListIterator getVertices()
Get an iterator to the verticies contained within the graph.

Returns:
A ListIterator starting at index 0

getVertices

public java.util.ListIterator getVertices(int index)

Parameters:
index - The position to start the interator.

depthFirstTraversal

public void depthFirstTraversal(PrePostVisitor visitor,
                                Vertex startVertex)
A traversal of the Graph starting at a specific Vertex

Parameters:
visitor - The PrePostVisitor to apply to the traversal
startVertex - The Vertex to start the traversal at

breadthFirstTraversal

public void breadthFirstTraversal(Visitor visitor,
                                  Vertex startVertex)
Performs a breadth first traversal on the graph. At each iteration, the visit() method of the Vistor is applied to the currently traversing Vertex

Parameters:
startVertex - The vertex to start the traversal from

printGraphSummary

public void printGraphSummary()
Print a summary of the Graph structure. The summary is 2 fold. First the summary is based on incident edges and then the summary is based on eminating edges.
